content: Richmond's dreary winless streak continues.
Another two goals for Zava are not enough
as Newcastle dismantle the Greyhounds 4-2.
The talent is clearly on the field, Chris.
It sure is, Arlo.
The problem with this team might be in the dugout.
Damn it!
Fuck.

Chris, since their loss to Nathan Shelley
and West Ham last month,

it seems the Greyhounds
have been dropping like a stone.

Well, all objects drop
at the same rate, Arlo. Except feathers.

Well said, Chris.
When Zava arrived, it was sunny days.
But now, if you're a Richmond fan,
you've got to feel like nothing is going your way.
Boo! Boo!
Things go from bad to worse
as Richmond welcome Manchester City mid-week.
They are not in form to finally crack the code against their sky-blue tormentors
as they fall to ninth place.
I knew positive thinking was bullshit!

- Oh. Wow, that's not very nice.
- What?

You know?

We just can't get over that hump.

point that baby right at the North Star
and follow it all the way home.

I think.

do you think you can take this as well?

uh, six months ago.

- And in a sea of anythings,

I went fishing
and caught myself a soul mate.
Oh.
Took her to see Hamilton on our first date.

- And then defended my honor.

Oh, God. Yeah. Get this.
It's intermission.

We're standing in line
to buy the CD of the soundtrack,

'cause I refuse to stream music.
And guess who's standing in front of us.

- Sir Anthony Hopkins.
- Can you imagine?

- Nope.

and asks if he'll film a little video
for Jessica's father as Hannibal Lecter,
you know.

So I grabbed that rapscallion

I just... One of me brain farts.

Anyway, uh, we should go.

You okay? Have you eaten?

Correct.

And once you're standing over them,

With a thick, heavy rope

Pummeling them over and over
